wikipedia_page.main: Charles Stuart Aubrey Abbott, 3rd Baron Tenterden KCB (26 December 1834 – 22 September 1882), was a British diplomat.

response: *Sir Edward Charles (9 October 1859 – 31 December 1914), married firstly the Hon. Gwen Elca Violett Abbot, daughter of Charles Abbott, 3rd Baron Tenterden with whom he had one son, Hugh. Secondly he married Edith Powell, and they had two sons (the future 6th and 7th Baronets), and one daughter.
** Charles Abbott, 3rd Baron Tenterden (1834–1882), British diplomat

link_mentions.page: Charles Stuart Aubrey Abbott, 3rd Baron Tenterden

response: He was married to Hon. Catherine Alice Abbott, daughter of Lord Tenterden, who survived him following his death on 14 May 1873. They had a daughter, Penelope Mary Gertrude, who in 1859 married her cousin Charles Abbott, 3rd Baron Tenterden.

Sinclair was assisted in his works by Demetrios Pieridis; Sinclair's 5 July 1879 report described: "2 Phoenician inscriptions have been found written in some sort of paint on stone & being (according to Mr. Pierides) accounts of wages." The finds were brought to the attention of the British Museum in 1880 in a report from Charles Thomas Newton, forwarding a letter from Charles Abbott, 3rd Baron Tenterden on behalf of Granville Leveson-Gower, 2nd Earl Granville. Newton's report stated:Bailey, D. M. “The Village Priest's Tomb at Aradippou in Cyprus.” The British Museum Quarterly, vol. 34, no. 1/2, 1969, pp. 36–58. JSTOR, www.jstor.org/stable/4423043. Accessed 31 Oct. 2020.
